Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: This well-designed site is bordered by the Great Western and Union Pacific railways, making it the perfect location for the business that relies on mobility or seeks a strategic location with close proximity to the Fort Collins-Loveland Municipal Airport, Interstate 70 or Interstate 80. Direct access is available via US Highway 34 just east of Interstate 25.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
In one of the fastest growing regions in the country, Iron Horse is one of Northern Colorado’s newest business parks. The development incorporates commercial and industrial uses. The lots range from 2 acres to a total of just over 74 acres and are available for lease, sale or build-to-suit and allow business owners to choose the perfect function. Iron Horse is surrounded by the region’s major transportation corridors and within a quick drive to all of the shopping, dining, hospitality, medical and business services in Centerra.
BUILD-TO-SUIT PRICING NEGOTIABLE
LOT PRICING $5.00/SF - $6.00/SF
GROUND LEASES AVAILABLE

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Shovel Ready Sites | Build to Suit Opportunities

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
This retail parcel floats near eye-level to 1-25 at the recently completed intersection of I-25 and Crossroads. Surrounded by hotels
and restaurants, this site is ideal for a variety of retail and commercial uses. Utilities stubbed to the property line and the installed
parking lot make it development-ready.

Two lots are available for development in the heart of the
most active mixed-use developments north of Denver. Prime
opportunity to acquire land to build next to some of the
strongest national brands, solid tenant performance, growing
population, and commercial synergy in the region.

Common.Highlight.Common.Text: Located in the heart of bustling and expanding Northern Colorado
Easy I-25 access and all the front Range communities from Cheyenne to Pueblo
Quick trip to Johnstown, Berthoud, Loveland, Greeley, Windsor, Fort Collins, Timnath
Near many NoCo shopping, dining, hospitality, regional and entertainment destinations and attractions

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
This area is accessible by the region’s major transportation corridors, a regional airport and hospital. This location is within a quick drive to popular area attractions,
destinations, and the seven most vibrant and expanding cities that comprise Northern Colorado. This property is poised for vital possibilities.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
Positioned at the epicenter of one of the fastest growing regions in the country, these
properties present opportunities for tenants to design new and efficient industrial flex work environments in the midst of an emerging industrial development in the heart of Northern Colorado at Centerra. These land parcels can each accommodate one large campus/facility or several smaller flex buildings.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Light Industrial Flex | Industrial Land | Build-to-Suit Opportunities

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
Take advantage of this hard-to-find office condominium project located in the active
Centerra community. Located northwest of the intersection of US Highway 34 and
I-25 in Centerra Marketplace. The Centerra shopping area includes multiple shopping, dining and hotel destinations. The Property has high visibility from US Highway 34 and neighbors the Loveland Chamber of Commerce, and numerous retailers.

5150 Hahns Peak Drive is ready to join the Centerra Office Park campus as a highly desirable location to the thriving Centerra community. Located northwest of the intersection of I-25 and US Highway 34 and adjacent to the Centerra Marketplace shopping center. The Centerra shopping area includes multiple shopping, dining, and hotel destinations. With new residential developments growing around the area, this intersection is a major hub for those entering Loveland from the interstate.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Office Land Available in Centerra Office Park

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Traffi c counts exceed:48,574 vehicles per day (Source: City of Fort
Collins GIS). Great Fort Collins location with easy access from Loveland. Join Ziggi’s
Coffee and Southgate Church at this prime corner. Lease rate and terms negotiable.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Opportunity for ground lease at the busy intersection of South College Avenue and Trilby Road in Fort Collins.

Common.Highlight.Common.Text: Located in the Colorado Enterprise Zone

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: The property, located on Clayton Place in Berthoud, Colorado is just south of Highway 287. With easy access via S County Road 15 and Lincoln Ave.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: The available property is an 18.06 acre land parcel located right off Hwy 287, with easy access to I-25. The owner will consider any build-to-suit opportunities.

Common.Highlight.Common.Text: Wildhorse Crossing annexation into the City of Pueblo will be completed November 1, 2021.
First lots will be available for development in the second quarter of 2022.
Approximately 600 additional acres north and east of the site will be simultaneously annexed. This joint annexation will represent an increase to the City of Pueblo of approximately 2%.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: Wildhorse Crossing is an upcoming, 150-acre mixed use project, located in Pueblo and Pueblo West on Highway 50, convenient to more than 160,000 residents in the Pueblo trade area. The site is the last, large development tract that is situated on main traffic arterials.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: 150-ACRE MIXED USE PROJECT - ENTERTAINMENT, SHOPPING, AND SERVICES IN SOUTHERN COLORADO’S PATH OF GROWTH

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
COMMERCIAL LAND

Located SEC US Highway 50 and Steinmeier Avenue in Cañon City, COLand for sale, lease or build-to-suitJoin Walmart Supercenter, ACE Hardware, Chili’s Restaurant, Home Depot and Coldstone CreameryThe Royal Gorge Bridge is the highest bridge in the United States. The bridge deck crosses the Royal Gorge 955 feet above the Arkansas River. The suspension bridge has a main span of 938 feet. The bridge is 1,260 feet long and 18 feet wide, and has a wooden walkway with 1,292 planks. The bridge is suspended from towers that are 150 feet high.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Located off Hwy 40 in a City Market anchored shopping center.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: Located at lighted intersection with excellent visibility from Hwy 40.

Common.Highlight.Common.Text: Potential uses: fast food, automotive, retail, drive-thru coffee

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
This development site is ideally situated at the
gateway to Western Colorado on US Highway 160.
Monte Vista, a town with a population of 15,000
(15 mile radius), is the heartbeat of the San Luis
Valley, and home to the famed Coors Brewing
barley crop production as well as the Monte Vista
National Wildlife Refuge and American Indian
Petroglyphs.
The site is located at the apex of two major
highways, with abundant commuter and tourist
traffic.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
There is one building on this lot.
Corner of HWY 285 and HWY 160
3 curb cuts provide access to the site
